itemDescription: British commander of the Royal Engineers

wikipedia_page.main:
Major General Sir Howard Elphinstone, 1st Baronet  (4 March 1773 – 28 April 1846) was a commander of the Royal Engineers in the Peninsular War.
Elphinstone was the youngest son of John Elphinstone, a captain in the Royal Navy and for a period a vice-admiral in the Russian Navy. His mother was Amelia, daughter of John Warburton.

response: *Sir Howard Elphinstone, 1st Baronet (1773–1846), Major-General in the Peninsular War

Elphinstone was the son of Lt.-Gen. Sir Howard Elphinstone, 1st Baronet (1773–1846) and Frances Warburton (died 1858). He was a barrister, and had the degrees of MA and Doctor of Civil Law (D.C.L.). He married  Elizabeth Julia Curteis, in 1829, and they had two children.

William Masters Smith (20 March 1802 – 24 December 1861) was a British Conservative Party politician. He was a Member of Parliament (MP) for West Kent from 1852 to 1857. He married Frances Elphinstone, daughter of Sir Howard Elphinstone, 1st Baronet, on 6 September 1836.
* Sir Howard Elphinstone, 1st Baronet, commander royal engineers in the Peninsular War, 1821–46.
